title: West Ham captain Mark Noble reveals he hasn’t spoken to wantaway star Dimitri Payet for three weeks
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments WEST HAM captain Mark Noble revealed he has not spoken to wantaway star Dimitri Payet for nearly three weeks. 
Payet is being given the cold shoulder by team-mates after refusing to play in the 3-0 win over Crystal Palace. News Group Newspapers Ltd 2 Noble admits they shared a great relationship but now no longer talk 
Noble, 29, said: “I have been here all my life so I find it hard to realise that someone wouldn’t want to play for the club. I had a great relationship with him but I don’t know his reasons. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog . 
“I haven’t spoken to him for the last two or three weeks. Dimi was adored here by the fans but football and fans change quickly.” 
And Noble backed manager Slaven Bilic for publicly shaming Payet, insisting: “Dimi clearly said to the manager he didn’t want to play for us any more so the boss was right in what he did. 
“I do know that if someone doesn’t want to play for the team then they are better off not even playing.” Getty Images Dimitri Payet is on strike at West Ham as he tries to force through a move to Marseille related articles Lud behaviour Dimitri Payet's wife has already moved back to France as unhappy star tries to force exit from West Ham DeJa Vu Dimitri Payet's chaotic situation must be familiar to West Ham fans... as boss Slaven Bilic did the same thing 20 years ago Mars jet in Marseille to make new Dimitri Payet bid... which would see unhappy star stay at West Ham for rest of season Hero to zero West Ham fans wipe their feet on Dimitri Payet shirt as Andy Carroll laps up Twitter praise after worldie West Ham striker Andy Carroll scores an outrageous overhead kick against Palace 
Hammers chiefs are braced for a fresh approach for the 29-year-old from Marseille this week , having rejected a £20million initial offer. 
Many believe a bid of £30m would be too much to turn down for a player of his age. 
But the Londoners insist they will not sell this month and have not given up hope of Payet performing an incredible U-turn and playing for the club again.
